entry.title: Large Behavior Models and Atlas Find New Footing | Boston Dynamics
entry.summary: Useful humanoid robots will require a long list of competencies. They will need the ability to manipulate a diverse range of objects (e.g. hard/soft, heavy/delicate, rigid/articulated, large/small), as well as to coordinate their entire bodies to reconfigure themselves, their environments, avoid obstacles, and maintain balance while responding to surprises. We believe that building AI generalist […]

entry.title: Robot Vision Systems: 3 Ways Robots See the World | Boston Dynamics
entry.summary: Modern robot vision systems use visual cameras, 3D lidar scans, and other sensors to interpret, navigate, and interact with their environment.

entry.title: Life Outside the Box for the Warehouse Worker | Boston Dynamics
entry.summary: Automated unloading tackles backbreaking labor and brings people out of hot containers in the summer, improving safety and quality of life.

entry.title: Getting Real with Humanoids | Boston Dynamics
entry.summary: Almost a year ago, we announced our new Atlas® robot—faster, stronger, more compact, and less messy. We’re designing the world’s most dynamic humanoid robot to do anything and everything, maybe even change work as we know it. How do we get there? One step at a time. At Boston Dynamics, we’ve learned a few things […]
